references.reason: This paper provides a characterization of multiclass learnability using the Daniely-Shalev-Shwartz (DS) dimension, which is crucial for understanding the sample complexity of multiclass learning, and its results are heavily relied upon in the current paper.

This paper establishes the fundamental connection between the DS dimension and multiclass learnability, laying the groundwork for further research on sample complexity in this area, and its findings are essential to the current work.

This paper introduces the concept of list learnability, which is closely related to multiclass learnability and provides a new perspective on the optimal sample complexity, thereby informing the analysis and results in this paper.

references.paper_title: The optimal sample complexity of PAC learning
references.reason: This paper addresses the optimal sample complexity for binary classification and provides valuable insights that are extended to the multiclass setting in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Optimal PAC bounds without uniform convergence
references.reason: This paper offers improved upper bounds on the sample complexity of multiclass learning, which provides a strong baseline to compare the results of this current paper against.
